alert.note: Alert for Stone; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:51AM CDT until March 27 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, south central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Camden, Maries and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Barry, Christian, Greene, Laclede, Stone and Webster. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 950 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Fort Leonard Wood, Republic, Lebanon, Branson, Marshfield, Battlefield, Waynesville, Cassville, Kimberling City, Strafford, Highlandville, St. Robert, Rogersville, Silver Dollar City, Clever, Seymour, Richland, Sparta, Dixon, Crane, Crocker, Purdy, Billings, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Fordland, Conway, Exeter, Doolittle, Indian Point, Branson West, Newburg, Galena, Washburn, Niangua, Diggins and Morgan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
